title: Jonerys Dream
body:
So I had this vivid dream I had leaked episodes of season 8 of GoT.  They were strangely enough just scenes between Jon and Daenerys.  The first was the fact both were visited by, I kid you not, a prophetic barkeep.  I think Dany laughed under her breath at the ridiculousness of this.  (reflects me well).  Apparently he had the dream of the “Golden Prince’  Their child and he was adament she was pregnant.  Dany of course in complete denial.

Jon on the other hand is silent in this strange expression of contemplation.  The next scene follows and they are in bed together.  Dany has fallen asleep, both naked, and Jon pulls the covers down to her hips.  His face travels down the length of her stopping at her navel and he just stares in awe.  I mean emotionally stirring awe.  Wonder and adoration fill his pupils as he lays his face against her navel as if listening and you the viewer are given this rare moment of a Jon Snow smile.

That is all I can remember and I am quite happy I did.  Bring it on Season 8!

blog.name: one-night-story
blog.title: The Fic Dumping Ground
blog.description:
The side blog to @with-the-words-all-wrong

In which I put all my writing and one place for the public to enjoy. I don’t take request and am simply using this to show work.

summary: Then I Get Another Letter, And I Cannot Put The Notion Away (Jon Snow)
body:
Then I Get Another Letter, And I Cannot Put The Notion Away (Jon Snow)

A/N: Yeah I don’t know either, I like looking at Kit Harington. Forgive me for any of my wrong knowledge. I’m setting it after the conclusion of the show. You can assign who the Queen is.

Althea Mersen, eldest daughter and Lady of the Reach felt like an uncontrolled teenager as she sat in her study. The sun was streaming in and it seemed to warm her even more than the pink that was flushing her cheeks. He had ruined her all over again.

Even with a continent between them he was still making her fall in love with him without knowing it. Althea stood by her sentiment that she had told Tyrion the first time he had come to visit her when she was first settling in the Reach. Every woman who meets Jon Snow in some way falls in love with him. Be it for his courage, his loyalty, his battle prowess, his beauty, or his quiet charm.

There are some women who experience all of these factors and those are always the women who fall the hardest. Althea had been so lucky, and she was still a puddle at his words. His first letter since the Queen’s corrination. She leaned forward and picked up the letter again, just to imprint the words into her brain.

My dearest, Althea

I have returned to Winterfell mostly unscathed. My wounds are healing nicely and I must thank you and the Maesters for that. I will struggle to know what to do with myself with no war and no fight to be fought. Sansa will settle well into this life, I’m unsure about Arya though. This peace shall ease the both of us and perhaps as you say “stop my brooding lines.”

I do miss you. And I wish duty will allow us to see each other again. Until then the ravens will get their feed. Do tell me how the Reach is, I’ve never had the honor of visiting there. (Not that Catlyn would have allowed it).

-Jon

Not one for fancy send offs, but that’s not what had her scrapping and rewriting letters senselessly. No it was much more subtle than that.

One stroke of a quill had eaten every waking moment of her spare time.

“My dearest, Althea.”

With the comma after dearest.

Knowing Jon, she was almost completely certain this meant nothing. But some small part of her that would always carry a torch for him until the day she was put into the Earth was captivated by that simple phrase. She leaned back over and set the letter back down. She picked up a quill and started writing a letter she very quickly she could never send.

My dearest Jon,

I’m glad to here that you have returned to the North and that you have considered easing your brooding lines. The Reach is lovely if not a bit excessive for most of my tastes. I’m making the most of it. I’m also certain that with time, Arya will make the adjustment to living in peace.

In the last letter I received from you, I noticed a comma in the middle of a phrase. It changed the meaning, did you intend this? It says “My dearest Althea” with the comma after dearest. You’ve written “My dearest, Althea.”

I miss you as well Jon. And I’m certain someday in our lives the stars will align to allows to see one another without a continent between us.

Farewell,

Althea

She read it over and couldn’t help but scream. Damn Jon Snow, how was he still managing to make her feel like this? Whatever this was. Althea sighed. She transfered the first and last paragraph onto a new page and sealed it with wax before passing it off to a servant to find a raven to deliver it. Althea then sat in her study in silence, letting the mere knowledge that she got to keep Jon Snow in her life give her comfort.

but it raises an interesting point anon
question: Thoughts on an OT3: Fanon!Jon/Book!Jon/Show!Jon
answer: there are too many jons, they would just triple the self-hate and cry a lot. on the other hand, keeping it in the family is the targaryen way 🤔

summary: Am I the only one where I’m like Jonsa is happening no matter what?! Like seriously, there is no “if Jonsa doesn’t happen I’m...
body: Am I the only one where I’m like Jonsa is happening no matter what?! Like seriously, there is no “if Jonsa doesn’t happen I’m totally fine” in this bitch. With all the incredible detailed metas plus gifsets showing countless parallels, all bets are in for me and all my cards are on the table for Jonsa! I have absolute faith in my Jonsa conviction and I’m sticking to it. I also don’t plan to be on the losing side of this GOT ship war!

summary: So, when Jon got stabbed to death, do you think Lyanna was sitting up in the Old Gods Afterlife like excited she was about to...
question: So, when Jon got stabbed to death, do you think Lyanna was sitting up in the Old Gods Afterlife like excited she was about to meet her son, or sad because he got violently murdered?
answer: Definitely sad. I’m sure she definitely would have wanted him to live a full life. It would kill her to see him die that violently.

reblog.comment: Definitely sad. I’m sure she definitely would have wanted him to live a full life. It would kill her to see him die that violently.

summary:
Jon Snow: I bet I could fit the whole world in my hands.
Daenerys Targaryen: Jon, that’s physically impossible.
Jon Snow: *cups...
body:
Jon Snow: I bet I could fit the whole world in my hands.
Daenerys Targaryen: Jon, that’s physically impossible.
Jon Snow: *cups Dany’s face with his hands* You think?
Daenerys Targaryen: *blushes* Stop it, I have a reputation.

summary: Hi! Sorry if you've already answered this, but show-wise how do you rationalize Jon giving up the North to Dany even after she...
question: Hi! Sorry if you've already answered this, but show-wise how do you rationalize Jon giving up the North to Dany even after she stopped asking it of him and had already pledged to fight the White Walkers? I want to think there's a better reason than him simply being eager/relieved to give up his kingly duties or worse (no sympathy for northern independence)...
answer:
I think it’s poor writing leading into a Jon/Dany marriage in s8. It’s undeniable that the writers didn’t totally forget that the Northerners are pretty keen on this independence gig, but that plot thread is almost totally located in Sansa’s plot, whereas Jon’s decision to pledge to Dany is repeatedly framed as an issue of pride.

What I think the writers are ultimately after are creating political conflict on both sides of the Jon/Dany relationship - Jon facing pushback over his decision to give up his title, Dany facing angst over the fact that Jon’s a legitimate Targaryen with a stronger claim than her own - that can be solved by them deciding to marry, neither subordinate to the other. 

I also think that the writers have prioritised the end result over the chain of events and the characterisation needed to get there. Hence we end up with Jon forgetting about all those political concerns that Sansa deals with in s7. Poor Jon’s got short shrift in adaptation, brainswise.

reblog.comment:
Read Chapter 22 on AO3 Here

Chapter Summary: Westeros High reacts to Ramsey’s arrest. Meanwhile, Jon and Daenerys enjoy some quality time together while Jon’s parents are out of town.

blog.title: Fandom Quotes
blog.description: Quotes from various fandoms, feel free to send in your favourites

summary: Let me give you some advice, bastard. Never forget who you are. The rest of the world will not. Wear it like armour and it can...
text: Let me give you some advice, bastard. Never forget who you are. The rest of the world will not. Wear it like armour and it can never be used to hurt you.

blog.name: nobodysuspectsthebutterfly
blog.title: Nobody ever suspects the butterfly...
blog.description:
Hey, you can call me Mindset, or Butterfly.
I like: Comics, ASOIAF, music, art, books, sf & fantasy, butterflies, birds, pretty rocks, and many other things. See my sidebar tags and links for more details.
I help mod: ASOIAF University and A Song of Theories.
Note to ASOIAF fandom followers: I've read all the books, and rarely if ever cut for spoilers, sorry. Please check my FAQ and the other links on my sidebar for more info.

summary: Do you think Jon Snow will become King in the North in Winds of Winter?
question: Do you think Jon Snow will become King in the North in Winds of Winter?
answer: I think that it is possible he will, especially considering the Robb’s will situation. But if he does, I very much doubt it will be through acclamation by northern lords after winning fame in battle. We’ll just have to see, though…

reblog.comment: I think that it is possible he will, especially considering the Robb’s will situation. But if he does, I very much doubt it will be through acclamation by northern lords after winning fame in battle. We’ll just have to see, though…

That’s a great information .
